project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If there is a period character (".") or ("_") inside a project key, then transitions between statuses could not be achieved in GH 5.7 and above.

However, in previous versions of GH (5.6.8 at latest), the transition can proceed smoothly.

For example:
# Use this project key pattern: ([A-Z][A-Z]+)([.]?)([A-Z][A-Z|0-9|_]*)
# Create a project with its project key containing the period character (Apple.Jack)
# Create issues in that project.
# Go to {{Agile > Task Board}}
# Try to transit issues from the Apple.Jack project to the next status.
fields.summary: Period or Underscore Character in Project Key Blocks Transitions in Task Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use 3 different levels of planning in our product backlog in our company:
- long-term (12 months)
- mid-term (3 months)
- short-term (next sprint)

The mid-term and short-term as well as the sprint planning itself is done via the planning board. Here we use the "original estimate" field to get a clue how "big" an issue will eb approximately.
We use the statistsics marker "time (remaining)" at the moment to identify which Stories may fit into the next sprint (e.g. 200h capacity in 2 weeks). It would be great if we could just add  another marker based on "time (remaining)" for the 3-month preview (e.g. 1200h in 3 months) to see which topics need to be refined to the next level of detail.

Just found this article http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Statistics and a comment stating that it's not possible yet and we may suggest it as a story. As i haven't found an according story, i filed it yet.
fields.summary: As a GH user i want to be able to use multiple markers of the same value (e.g. original estimate) in order to see my short-term and my mid-term planning

fields.description:
Graph for Issue Burndown Chart in GH chartboard is not rendering properly if there are issues created after start date.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create 5 issues and assigned it to a version with a start date
* Later after start date has passed (or change system date), create another 5 issues
* Value for guideline won't change as expected and only remaining values will change but remaining value line will overshoot out of the graph

Check screenshot for a clear picture on the situation.
fields.summary: Issue burndown chart line overshoot if issues created after start date

fields.description:
Pre-Conditions:
*Use one of the unsupported browsers below
*Rapid Board is enabled under GreenHopper Labs (under GreenHopper General configuration in the admin page)
*Use a jira-admin enabled user
*Have no Rapid views created under your user

Steps To Reproduce:
   1. Login to Jira
   2. Select Agile > Rapid Board
   3. Click "create a rapid view"
   4. Enter in a name and a valid filter (private)
   5. Click the "Create" button
   6. Click on Agile > Manage Rapid Views
   7. Click on Operations > Edit next to the rapid view that you created
   8. Blank screen appears - no errors in logs or on the browser

Below are the combined versions that have been tested.

*Browsers/Versions that don't work*
FireFox:
3.6.9
3.6.13
3.6.18
3.6.20

IE:
8 
9

*Browser/Versions that do work*
Chrome:
13.0.782.215

FireFox:
6.0
fields.summary: Unable to edit via Manage Rapid Views in IE and most versions of FireFox

fields.description:
For an user with no apparent remaining work for a given version, I have correct total in one Greenhopper view, and non-null total in another !

Remaining is 0 if I select "OnTheFly"/PlanningBoard/Assignee/theuser/version1.0.0 ==> this is correct total.
Remaining is 13.5 days if I select "myContext"/PlanningBoard/Version/1.0.0 where "myContext" is just filter on theuser

Please note that all tasks within this version for this user hav no remaining estimate, and are resolved.

I have this problem only with this user, but the error is added up when selecting the whole version ("On the Fly" context) therefore preventing us from using the version total remaining work. The overall total is also false in the chart burdown graph total (i.e. it includes the ghost "13.5" days).

Everything behaves as if there was an invisible remaining task of 13.5 days for this user, that can be seen nowhere, and that is not added up when using the "Assignee" inbuilt view !!!

Please note that the listed issues are the same if I select them using Jira custom requests, and show no remaining work for this user in the version.

Sorry not to be able to provide data extracts, as the project is of confidential nature. I can provide additional anonymised information of database content if needed (including mysql extracts).

fields.description:
When adding the GH agile gadget to a confluence page it will display one chart the first time it's being viewed, but it will fail for any consecutive attempts.
Only after 2 hours it will work once and then stop to work again for two hours.

This issue is due a missing NO-CACHE header on the response of the gadget resource which generates the image.
Adding the header Cache-Control: NO-Cache will fix this problem.

GreenhopperRessource.java (IMHO: java class should be renamed to GreenhopperResource)
Line 129
{code}
return !errors.isEmpty() ? createValidationResponse(errors) : Response.ok(new GHGadget(preferences)).cacheControl(com.pyxis.greenhopper.gadget.CacheControl.NO_CACHE).build();
{code}

As part of this issue, I suggest you review all other responses which contain dynamic data and make sure they have the required NO-CACHE header.
If no caching behavior is specified inside JIRA the response will not have any caching information, but when going through the gadget proxy it will add a default cache timeout of 2 hours. Which means these gadgets will stop to work in external gadget containers.

fields.description:
If the value of "The number of working hours per day" consist of decimal ( e.g 8.4), stack trace below will be thrown after adding GreeHopper Task Board Gadget ,and default value (8 hours ) will be used instead:

{noformat}
2011-08-18 17:10:15,024 http-8080-3 ERROR cyrill.ruettimann 1030x33x1 6s2dse 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/task-board/generate.json [greenhopper.service.team.GreenHopperTeamAllocationProvider] Unable to fetch hours per day. Using 8 as default
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "8.4"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:458)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:499)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.team.GreenHopperTeamAllocationProvider.getSecondsPerDay(GreenHopperTeamAllocationProvider.java:89)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.team.GreenHopperTeamAllocationProvider.getTimeAllocation(GreenHopperTeamAllocationProvider.java:77)
{noformat}

*Steps to replicate*
# Set "The number of working hours per day" to 8.4 in Time Tracking setting.
# Add GreenHopper Task Board Gadget to Dashboard
# Stack Trace above will be thrown in the log.
|

*Finding*
* Affected GH 5.6.1 to GH 5.7.1
* Planning board and Task Board under Agile Tab handle this situation correctly and no error thrown in log. 
|

fields.description:
When displaying the sub-task column in a Filter result gadget on a dashboard the sub-task ID will be scratch if the sub task status is in RESOLVED and CLOSED. 
The Agile Task Board will display the sub-task scratch only if the sub-task is in CLOSED state.

This is confusing.
The sub-task should be scratch only when it's closed not when it's resolved on the Filter Result Gadget.

From our Jira Administrator: 
There are some details about this. The difference between JIRA and GH is that JIRA crosses issues when issue has resolution. GH treats issue as completed when it is in the last bucket in Task Board. In our case it is Closed. Saying more, GH treats issues in the first bucket as "To Do" and as "Done" in last bucket. Issues in any bucket in-between them are treated as "In Progress" . It is visualized on three color bar in GH. Red - To Do, Yellow - In Progress, Green - Done.
fields.summary: In JIRA a sub-task is crossed out when it is Resolved, while in Greenhopper it is crossed out when Closed.

fields.summary: First time setting Project Template to Scrum produces rendering error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The bug is a consequence of allowing the user to add multiple resolutions to columns at a time, when in fact there is no indication that this is not possible.
Either there should be an indication (greying out further selections with a note mentioning this), or it should be allowed.

http://screencast.com/t/5cQQjB1Nr
fields.summary: Mapping multiple Resolutions to Columns is allowed but actually invalid

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have a local JIRA instance Version 4.3.
I created a GH Enabled Project.
I took a backup of data on this local instance.
I imported the data backup in Studio (Version: 107.4 r127028)
On viewing the RapidBoard view, there is a difference noticed. Please view the attached screenshots. I have highlighted the difference in two screens in purple.
fields.summary: GH: Difference in RapidBoard View in Studio and JIRA instance.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, my boss asked me to submit following bug report for greenhopper, please let me know if you need futher details.

In the project I am currently working on, we are assigning each issue that is not in the backlog to two fix versions, one for the current sprint, one for 1.0 (in order to track overall project progress across sprints). Due to changing requirements (the old story), the release date for 1.0 has been changed from June 1 to September 1.

Now, in my project-specific dashboard, I have the Agile Gadget showing the burndown chart, and I use the combo box to either look at the current sprint or at 1.0. However, the 1.0 burndown chart keeps showing the time until June 1 on the X axis, showing the project as horribly late, and not progressing (since we are beyond June 1, of course). However, the Agile Gadget does show the correct release date, Sept. 1 near the top.

Upon further investigation, when opening the 1.0 version in Greenhopper's Planning Board, and toggling visibility to show all data, it shows both a release date (Sept. 1) and an "end date" (June 1, still). So apparently, it's the end date, not the release date, that the Agile Gadget is using. But when going to "Manage Versions" and trying to edit that version, it only shows me the release date, so there is no way I can set the end date to Sept. 1 as well.
fields.summary: Burndown chart doesn't update release dates

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The dates in the Chart Board of rendered inappropriately, to the point it becomes unreadable.

Back in GH 5.6, the dates are well rendered and easily readable.
!5_6_5_burndown.png|thumbnail!

In the current release of GH, the font size becomes larger and thus overlaps each other.
!5_7_burndown.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Dates Rendered Inappropriately in Chart Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS:
- new Reporting design from Martin including time/chart/column/quick filter/swimlane filtering
- allow selection of columns to be shown in the chart
- default to selection of all columns
- analytics for chart and filter selections incl timeframe/QF/columns/swimlanes
fields.summary: As a rapid board user I want the ability to view my charts by columns so that I can measure CFD/cycle time/etc for specific transitions

fields.description:
How this screenshot was produced (on JAC):

1) I started progress on BON-224 and kept the Task Board open
2) Someone else resolved BON-217
3) Almost straight afterwards, I dragged BON-224 to the Done column (without having refreshed the Task Board) and completed the dialog to resolve the issue, which obviously fires some AJAX request(s?).
When the AJAX had finished doing its stuff, a new card for BON-217 was correctly added to my Done column, but the original card was still listed in To Do as well.
fields.summary: Task Board: Drag-n-Drop race condition can duplicate views of an issue

fields.description: As a Kanaban team lead I want to limit my WIP (work-in-progress) for each column on the taskboard. Further, the work items for our team vary in size and therefore we use story points as a measure of effort required for each item. Given this workflow it would be helpful if we could set column constraints that were based on the total number of story points for all issues in a given column.

fields.description:
SiteMesh in 5.0 is more strict about what it accepts, we need to have a proper structure of
<html><head></head><body></body></html> in order to get the head elements inserted at the correct place.

Parts of this cleanup should be to move whatever variable we currently create in velocity out into a resource file, to ensure its loaded at the correct location/sequence inside the page (e.g. the GH namespace needs to be defined already for GH.abc to not explode)

Work doable in 4.4, to be forward compatible.
fields.summary: Fix up Sitemesh head/body structure used by GH (broken in 5.0)

fields.description:
Big Story, Let's Break It Down!

COS:
- Automatically migrate the GreenHopper Rank field in an instance with only one GreenHopper Rank field to the Global Rank, take projects in alphabetical order and then the rank within the project over to the Global Rank
- Make the Global Rank the rank field that is used in the Classic Mode, switch all projects and contexts to Global Rank
- If there are multiple GreenHopper Rank fields then do not run the auto-upgrade task, lock GreenHopper until an admin selects which GreenHopper Rank field to migrate to the Global Rank (we will make a note of this in the Upgrade Guide too), once they have migrated move the other GreenHopper Rank fields to a Number Custom Field with a locked absolute rank per project for historical purposes
- If the Global Rank is enabled and in use we use the same approach where they have multiple GreenHopper Rank   
- Do not remove the GreenHopper Rank field yet
- Give them a way to back out by downgrading GreenHopper to 5.7.2, which is okay before we have not performed any upgrade tasks
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user I would like the Global Rank to be the ranking field used in the Classic Mode
